DHil0M3hVMAZPhSuRrpqkQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! i got there ten minutes before they opened but the lady was nice enough to let us in :) (some people are REALLY rude and don't even bother noticing you. that's when you know you should walk away, fyi). But yes, the interior was cute and small. After we were seated, we ordered our food. I orded the Dol Sot Bibimbop. AMAZING. the egg was actually visible! ahha the rice was really good as well as the vegetables that came along in the stone pot. The seafood bibimbop was also amazing. Their miso soup however does taste like any other miso soup. Their green tea however is a MUST TRY! Comes in a little teapot per order :)

Y5gyJhNI_4VIwwgg9yfJ7w.text: tasty and inexpensive!  got the beef bulgogi bibimbap, and shared jap chae & tofu appetizers.  the steamed tofu was fine, but not amazing, while the jap chae was quite tasty.  the beef bulgogi was delish...and i even ordered it with brown rice (my attempt to be healthy).  there was not a grain left. very clean & new looking, good for a quick, casual meal.  service was also quite pleasant.   i have to say, i was a bit skeptical about the food when i saw how 'chain-y' the place looked, but after eating there...i'd definitely go back.  thumbs up.

4xR10XyMNNib7Bl3Wqq-1Q.text: Quick, tasty and quite cheap. Not the best bi bim bap available. Portions seemed small and were over-simplified. Try Koba or Ran for much better examples of this dish.

0EDwURgn1k7BsdIuwFUbMg.text: The bibimbap is almost as delicious as what I had in Korea and reasonably priced considering it's London and not Seoul.  There's a variety of dishes to choose from.  You go away feeling full and satisfied but it's healthy food so you don't feel bad about cleaning your plate - lots of yummy veggies.  The staff is friendly and the service is quick.  There are lots of photos on the walls and k-pop in the background.  I always enjoy a dinner here!

I2GSKf6P3DGi-diNxH2mbQ.text: Great value ad very tasty food. Came here prior to a night out and had the Bulgogi BiBimBap, which I added about 3 kgs of Siratcha to. Very flavour and for £7, you can't complain. One of my mates, who eats like there is no tomorrow, found the portion too small. He then ordered the dumplings and thought that the dumplings might be his favourite part of the meal. Great location and value!

cp2GOLClXWEbAtRfTB8Tug.text: possibly the weirdest name for a restaurant i'd ever encountered....then was enlightened by the lovely staff that it's a traditional Korean dish, oh of course?!!bi offers a great range of healthy grub thats really tasty, it's also a great place to go if your vegetarian.This includes the signature dish which comes out still cooking in the hot stone bowls which lady stirs up for you, sadly they don't feed you as well however.the real treat of this place is that they take a polaroid of you after the meal, pin it to the wall and get you to sign it...how cute!!the place was lacking in atmosphere a bit but i'm guessing that's cos it was so new, you could still smell the paint!if your in soho a great place to check out for luncheon or dinner just make sure you get blue steel ready...say cheese now!

4zjI3UHhnlgt46JkQunYew.text: Must go and eatery  place in soho on Greek street very cute tiny place yet everything very tasty great service before any show or for a a nice dinner out Korean style dishes ...

zFRJJExz1RVf3AMzyENXXg.text: We wanted Korean food and found this gem on Yelp. Service was slow because it was crowded but the food was absolutely delicious! We had the beef bool-go-go hot stone bibimbap the pork & vegetable mandoo, the dol sot and the chicken bowl. All excellent and those bowls were darn hot!

-yM0hqcgdLr2rPiqZP60rA.text: Really great food and speedy service. We had Kimichi pancakes (delicious) and Dol Sot Bi Bim Baps. Couldn't have asked for more.

91ySPudMEefFB7Sr_tmlkA.text: So glad that a friend and firm enthusiast introduced me to this place. Such a great find. The waiters are relatively low-profile, so don't be afraid to go and find them for ordering, but awesome food and you HAVE TO go for the Beef Bool-Go-Gi  served in a warm stone bowl too so if you're looking for a leisurely lunch stays warm, moorish and delicious, look no further!

XHsT4yzexGqPK3jrUBHVlw.text: bi bim bap...fun to say, fun to eat!

kvJFHW_bMImAwD_fEVm-IA.text: I love this place. It's great for a quick bite to eat. They service is fast and friendly. I've taken friends that have never tried Korean food and every person I've taken so far likes it.

0vkbDgQziY_wwBB_bay9gg.text: Greasy kimchi pancakes, service for bibimbap was so slow we just gave up after 40 minutes waiting. Very rude guy in charge who couldn't care less about anyone, when asked about when the food was coming he just yelled coming soon and walked off. If you love Korean food like me don't spoil your evening with this poor excuse for a restaurant.

gqgohR0j2geDPCtP1xnEjg.text: As a starter we've ordered kimchi and dumplings. Although not marked as spicy, the kimchi was too hot for most of us. Dumpling were perfectly done. We've ordered 4 different kinds of bibimbop, all were delicious. It recommended! We've returned the next night :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Chicken bibimbop

5XtyWQqMP8vl1Jl5faX6EA.text: Came here with 5 friends for a long overdue catch up. The atmosphere is very casual and serves primarily bibimbap.I ordered the most traditional bibimbap and the kimchi pancake. Was a huge fan of both! The bibimbap was fresh in a very very hot stone bowl! The kimchi pancake was flavourful and delicious.The people here were friendly and very patient with our group. Many thanks! Highly suggest for you to come here if you're looking for a relaxed place to catch up over Korean food!

7Ck7K2gvaf_y-UbNcxKmNA.text: It was solid. Not disappointing but you know, something that make you feel "yeah ok, what else?".We came here on a friday night, of course without reservation, 6 people. In 5 minutes they had freed a table for us, it's very causal, kind of fast food style.We took some shared appetizers, you can actually avoid them, not bad but really, nothing interesting.The main dish is of course the bibimap (say it again, bibimap. Lovely word, isn't it!? BI BI MAP!), a bowl of rice, vegetables and meat with a fried egg on top, coming in hot stone bowl (I repeat, HOT stone bowl. Don't try to steal your neighbor's one, I'm still paying the consequences!). Now, it's good. I mean, it's the kind of dish you have and you thing "well ok, that was solid good dish", but nothing to scream on the road about it waving a pair of chopsticks, it is just good. stop.And Cheap. Which is good, I would rather pay one pound more and have a bit more rice in my bowl, but that's it.I'd suggest it for tourists or for lunch, but otherwise.. well try it once, I don't think you'll feel like coming back in a short period.

_VIX1d5_5P6a0HlagyRZZA.text: I was trying to finish up my souvenir shopping in the area, but my protesting stomach told me to quickly drop by here. Now despite the name of this eatery, I didn't order the bibimbap. I ordered the spicy pork with rice and it was delicious. A bit disappointed that my meal didn't come with any banchans though. Nonetheless, very quick service (food came in what felt like 3 minutes), reasonably priced, and delicious food. Would recommend! Note: Cash Only!

LKwJqht1lIdVRaUXWBzOPA.text: Bibimbap has two big things going for it: The price and the speed. If you're looking for a quick meal in Soho before seeing a show, this is a pretty good place to go. I came here with Isabel and Jane to get a bite, and I had the spicy pork Bibimbap. I also ordered the Kimchi and some dumplings to start because I was hungry. The kimchi was really nice (but not amazing). The dumpling were probably the best thing I ate there. Really hot, soft and delicious. The bibimbap itself is always a lot of fun (especially if you for the raw egg, which I recommend) as then you stir in the raw egg with your food to cook it in the bowl. Always a good time. And it was nice, not amazing, but good. I did add quite a bit of the miso and the spicy sauce to mine as well to give it a bit more flavor.So yeah, I'd come back if I need something quick and cheap. Although I think if I'm looking for something specifically Korean, I'd probably try another place.

9ErooatAOmp35Qr9MwF9kQ.text: I'm glad I forgot to review Bibimbap until the second time I went. And maybe it was the fact that it was summer time the next time I ate here but I just didn't like it as much as the first time. I had the spicy pork the first time and bulgogi beef the second, two toppings that I really enjoy outside of bibimbap. Maybe I just have a major preference for spicy pork, but the bulgogi was just okay! I wasn't a big fan of the dumplings either - they tasted okay but I think the dumplings at Seoul Bakery were just as good, and cheaper!The service was fine; you did kinda need to flag them down if you wanted more water or the bill but I feel like that's kind of standard for a lot of restaurants in London.I definitely should go back in the winter time to see if I think any differently about it again, because maybe it was just that a sizzling hot stone bowl in the summer is just not as appetising!

T4hVNuc5b2AxKI-luCm8HQ.text: Central, cheap, and tasty. What more could you ask for in a casual restaurant?Bibimbap Soho is a pretty popular place, so there may be a wait if you visit during peak hours. Don't worry though, as other reviewers mentioned, they turn tables quickly here. You won't have to wait long.The interior of the restaurant isn't going to win any awards, but that doesn't matter much when you're immersed in a piping hot bowl of bibimbap.Expect to spend £8-£12 per main and maybe another £3-£5 for a drink. The star of the menu is, not surprisingly, the bibimbap, but go ahead and treat yourself to some starters too. They're pretty delicious. The bibimbap here comes in the standard nuclear hot stone bowl and is filled with white rice, your choice of vegetables, meat, and that lovely runny egg. It's not the best I've had in the world (my mom's Korean ya'll), but it's a great value for Central London at around £10. The food comes out quickly and the service is, well let's just call it 'attentive'. You get about 5 minutes to look at the menu and decide, and 2-2.5 hours at your table in total. After that, you will kindly be asked to leave, so don't expect to linger here all night.

AYtm9KgMIaO4sGUBlnSUgg.text: I went on a Thursday with a friend and we both ordered the bibimbap rice dishes in the hot stone bowl. We both absolutely loved our meal, and for 7.50 pounds it was a generous portion.The restaurant was a bit warm and the seating was really tight. It was hard to get in to the bench because the tables were so close together and there was no where really to put a jacket or purse. The meal came very quickly, so it's a good place to go if there's a free table and you don't have a lot of time. Overall we really enjoyed the restaurant/meal and plan to go back with friends.

-2y6fGznVC-VvCAA_FropQ.text: Dang, that was disappointing. Fairly decent food in a charmingly quirky space, completely ruined by weird customer service.I can give Bi Bim Bap a little benefit of the doubt over the fact that I arrived really late to our small dinner party (was having too much fun at the Yelp Audio Lounge event--stunning sound and free gin, go figure) of five, and it was confusing to have one person order while everyone else was finishing up. What happened next, though, was even more stunning than the Audio Lounge stereos:Server: Are you finished?Friend: *with hands on bowl* I'd quite like to hold on to it, it's so warm!Server: *makes gesture to clear stone bowl*Friend: Oh, but may I keep it a little longer, please? It's just so nice to hold!Server: No. *takes stone bowl*Me: *jaw drops*Okay, so maybe there's a second benefit of the doubt in the fact that my friend has an abnormal fondness for cuddling heated crockery, but she was being charming and smiley about it, and the server was being humorless and rude. The restaurant wasn't even very busy at this time, so the theory that they needed the bowl to serve more bibimbap was out.Or so we thought. Some ten or so minutes later, four steaming bibimbaps appeared for my friends. Who had already eaten their bibimbaps (and had their stone bowls snatched back by force). After a brief moment of confusion, the bowls and servers stole away as quickly as they appeared, with someone muttering at us "we didn't cross the order off" by way of reluctant explanation. Mistakes are understandable, but somehow the interaction left us feeling really guilty that four perfectly good bibimbaps were being sent back to the kitchen because of us.Oh yes, and there was also this gem of an interaction:Friend: May we see the dessert menu?Server: No.We then figured out that they don't serve dessert, but what a response! To add insult to injury, there was no toilet paper in the ladies room (or the men's--I checked). There was an apologetic staffer who came back with a roll--but only after I asked for it.And the dol sot bibimbap was fine--but definitely not as memorable as the customer service.

kUH7tuSr2t_IGzqUDT-DSw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. Bi bim bap. Get the bi bim bap, hence the name. I ordered the Beef Bool-Go-Gi bi bim bap for 6.95 and I have to say, it's up to par! It comes in a sizzling stone bowl so your food is hot throughout the whole time you are eating which means you might even start sweating a bit like me. Make sure you put lots of the red sauce in...soo delicious. My friend had the spicy chicken ramen, not sure if it's the real name, but it tasted legit like it came from a instant noodle pack..so stick with the bi bim baps! BUT it was very good ramen lolThe price is amazing if you compare it to other places, to me anyways because I would think bi bim bap would be more expensive but it's pretty much american pricing which is great! This place is way too cute..I came here tonight at 630pm and within 30 mins the top floor was filled up..the bottom floor wasn't open but that's where the bathrooms/loos are located and they even have posters of 2NE1 and Girl's Generation. There are loads of small photos on the top floor that they made a design of it, I wondered how they got on the wall..i wanna be part of it :PGreat food, great prices, fast service...love it.

gMfL_Aif6RC4miMNDK1uDg.text: This place is my ultimate hangover cure - stodge and super tasty to soak up the booze. I visit this place quite regularly as it is super cheap (£8 for a main), very central and ridiculously scrumptious. I normally go for the beef bi bim bap which comes in a hot stone dish and kinda cooks in front of your eyes if you get the raw egg on top.It gets quite busy so sometimes you have to queue but it's worth the wait for sure. The staff are friendly enough and the service is quite quick.

ata8MUiGCJkv3jSXayXHiQ.text: Nice little korean spot in London Soho.  The bibimbop I ordered was a pretty good price.  The flavor is definitely good and the dish was satisfying.  Next time I'll order something with meat. This place is definitely veggie friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Vegeterian Dol Sot Bibimbap

l7VbhSfMi1BpCZ5r6u0ajw.text: Due to it's proximity to Soho I only ever come here when I'm good and drunk. This means that anything I taste has to fight its way through a haze of alcohol delirium before I actually register how tasty it actually is.With Bi Bim Bap I don't have this problem. I can still taste a million different flavours slowly cooking from raw on the edge of giant stone bowl hot enough to melt jewellery. It's amazing.The fillet beef is as tender as you like according to how much you mix it in with the other ingredients and the Kimchi is tangy and sweet. All enjoyed with a nice cold Hite.I cannot fault this lovely little place. No matter my level of drunk...

HJ-D7_va3t1QiGv9VMQpgA.text: yummy bibimbap but a little expensive (but that's really just how London is). quick, hot, and filling. pay extra to get the egg on top, raw if you're adventurous!

1Ku6TN7YN5Nt_iSaKS6FbA.text: If you're looking for authentic Korean dishes, then Bi Bim Bap is right up your alley. I was a stranger to Korean food until I took a trip to Seoul in 2012. Once there, I fell in love with the food, especially my love of Kimchis. Bi Bim Bap reproduce the food exactly as I remembered it from Seoul and the prices are very reasonable (especially if you purchase their meal deals).The bad thing about them is to do with the limited amount of dining space available. On a busy day, the place can get full very quickly and the tables are on the small side, so even if you manage to get a table, it is difficult to place all plates on them (especially with large orders). Overall, I love this place and recommend it.

lTV_5pycg4E5VX6jRvM5Iw.text: Bi Bim Bap is a cute little place in Soho that serves fresh Korean food in a jiffy.  After a morning of wandering around Mayfair, my boyfriend and I came in here for lunch after reading a review in the Guardian.  We were seated quickly even at midday lunch - the crowd was mostly tourists - and though the room was pretty full, downstairs where the toilets are they have another dining area so you shouldn't ever be waiting long.I got the mixed seafood bibimbap.  Bibimbap, for those who don't know, means "mixed rice" and is served in a hot (very!!) stone bowl.  You'll get rice (extra charge for brown), mixed veggies, and marinated meat.  On the table are hot sauce and miso sauce.  Often a raw egg is placed on top and gets cooked as your stir the bowl around.  This is one of the only foods I know of where your dish actually gets hotter as you eat!  It starts out warm but the bowl heats it throughout, so by your last bite you'll be in danger of scalding your tongue!  Great on a cold day.The portions here are small, and I think the flavors need to be upped a fair bit.  The meat has allegedly been marinated but tastes plain, and without tons of added sauce from the table, there's really not much flavor.  And the rice didn't stick to the bowl (maybe not enough sesame oil?) - eating the crisp rice at the end is supposed to be one of the best parts!It's serviceable and pretty healthy, but I would've liked to see a bit more flavor and a slightly bigger portion!  (I'm Amurrrrican, sorry.)

jQA5kiKnKmt9smwMw0bg7Q.text: Love this place. Bi bim bap is my favorite food in the world, and this place does it so well! This is due in large part to the brown rice option that is available. It isn't the most traditional Korean restaurant in London, but your food is ready in 10 minutes and it's reasonably priced. Healthy, fresh and fast.Gamsahabnida, Bi Bim Bap!

CY87dryfO9xtb7R95K-5Mg.text: I LOVE. Good value for money but most importantly absolutely delicious. We ordered a Chives Mandoo and Spicy Rice Cakes and that was tasty.  Careful Rice cakes can be very filling.  Then I had the Hot Stone BBB Spicy Pork with a raw egg - LORD SAVE MY SOUL. The whole thing was tasty. The Shitake Mushroom was plentiful, the pork was not too much where it overpowered. So tasty that I didn't need to add miso or chili sauce.  Oulong tea was proper.  Only issue is the space is tight and they are understaffed. Oh one more thing that is absolutely charming. The glass doors and parts of the walls were decorated with K-Pop artistes. It's so authentic!WILL RETURN FOR SURE!

mI5CcZ5k8EbPVQ3geVdDJA.text: Not worth the wait and food so hot when served it burnt our palates. Not the best introduction to Korean cuisine either. I'm sure the queues have improved as we went in the first week of its opening, so we felt a bit kettled like sheep.

zvee2fV3Kr12FfF2bqoytQ.text: Great place for a post work catch up with friends. Great dishes at reasonable prices and lovely little spot to while away the evening. Especially nice beers!

h2Yr-MOV0zegfIdYwPLS6Q.text: Price: £ (£8 for one bowl of bibimbap)Portion: 4/5 (one bowl easily feeds two people with an appetizer and some sides)Friendliness: 2/5Taste: 2/5Convenience: 4/5I remembered going to this place A LOT when I lived in London before, so I brought my man here for a recent visit to the city and I was not as impressed as I used to be.Portions are good, but bulgogi meat was dry and I missed having free banchan (side dishes like kim chee and other veggies or noodles). We did order kimchee for an extra quid and a half, and the bibimbap is cheap enough so that the whole meal is still relatively inexpensive, but I probably would not come back. It is conveniently located in Soho, so it could be a good choice for a quick bite before a show or after shopping, but I wouldn't go out of my way to return. TIPS:- The line can be long, but it doesn't take long to be seated. - Arrive before 7:30 pm to avoid a crazy line.- Share a bibimbap bowl and try appetizers to get more flavor.

iXFuanOcOcmoKWgIDHl4iw.text: Bibimbap is one of my favorite Korean dishes and this place makes BOMB bibimbap! Stopped in last night for dinner and had to wait 15 minutes or so for a table. I was a little annoyed because there was an open table for two that they refused to give up because it was "reserved," and nobody sat there the entire time I was there, but anyways...What we ordered:-Chili Squid- not bad, but I've definitely had better at Wagamama, for example.-Jap Chae- a little soggy, flavor was more mild than what I would've liked.-Beef Bulgogi Bibimbap- AMAZING! The best dish by far. Very, very tasty and the reason I'll be coming back to this place.-Chicken Bulgogi w/ rice- very plain, just chicken and rice. Nothing to brag about.I'm coming back for the Beef Bulgogi Bibimbap. I loved it!

Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Chili chicken bulgogi
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Gyoza

ok2j1BoXuzoJiESXdxBYYw.text: I tasted British-style,American-style and India-style in past few days.Now I have to go back to Asian food in order to make a rest! I yelped this place and tried Chilly chicken+Aloe Vera Juice+Fried egg.Delicious!Nice choice.The waitress looks like a friend of mine though she looks a little nervous against me-such a stranger.My friend asked me why not take a pic?Oh,yes,I didn't expect to threaten any shy girl and looked weird.Anyway,stunning food.Worthing my 30mins underground+walk.

22cVwvcbTFb_DXywVRM2Xg.text: Very good food. Small place that quickly fills up during lunch. A lot of Asian customers so it must be good. ;)Cash is preferred. Korean chicken was really good. Bibimbap was pretty good too.

qjV4wOmvL49DsLi6mgV8fw.text: Huge, delicious warm bowls of Bibimbap at very affordable prices. Delicious Kimchi too.This is a great place to get a fast, filling bowl of great Bibimbap. Super specialised and pretty authentic, this restaurant has fast decent service. Make sure you order an extra egg and go crazy with the chilli sauce!

i6vCgVgn6-ACYrcnXdZErw.text: Bibimbap..Bibimbap it sounds like something from a song...it is just typical Korean dish served in the hot stone bowl. We were in a neighborhood and up for a warm, not too expensive Korean meal. This place ticked all of the boxes. You have some starters to choose from, big range of bibimbap and drinks card. We ordered two different meat dishes - spicy pork and bulgogi with some kimchi on the side. To drink - ice green tea - and beware it is not sweetened.Spicy pork was delicious, flavorsome, however bulgogi lacked a bit in taste and spices used. Adding a bit of chili sauce helped. Kimchi was ok, not great..I had better - they could also serve a bit bigger portion. All in all it was a very tasty dinner and great option for a quick meal..not a romantic place, however good for a nice meal.

KHrpHbEIInY115Z0PLGwFQ.text: Recently went again and found out their prices have gone up by about £1.50 all over - it's still cheap-ish I guess - but it's lost it's allure for me slightly now. Food still just as good... Can't complain. Definitely a nice healthy and warming option for the colder months.

8mTK06e7liDqdwuQ_F3baA.text: Very very tasty!! Good for veggie options. Light and friendly. The service was polite and helpful. Price is suitable for what you're getting. Nice experience overall.

HDberFyHlpn0tCtzrn28qg.text: A must go for those who fancy korean food! I had a beef bimbimbap it was nice but for me the meat is not enough. Recommend Teriyaki Chicken rice, big portion and delicious! and the korean fried chicken is yum!! We (5 of us) went there for a dinner but we queued for 40 mins. But a table for 2 takes much less time to get.

KySho4pT5f4vRqMk0DxUPw.text: Great food...sizzling hot and spicy. One of my most memorable meals in London. Simplicity.

B42Nr2OMFy1FtG8hz0wmIw.text: Very very very nice meal...and I really really really enjoy it.This time I go there alone because is weekday, however, next time I would definitely bring loads of friends there.It is too too too yummy, not only the BiBimBap, I would also very much like to try other food and starters on their meal, basically I would like to try all their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

tI53PC_FhtKJTdtCoINHow.text: I'm new to Korean food, so I'm still just really excited about bibimbap in general. What a revelation.Granted this may skew my review somewhat... but this place has quickly become my go-to. I take friends from out of town (to impress them with my insider knowledge), I take myself on solo lunch dates, I take Londoners for buzzy Friday night dinners (to impress them with my non-insider insider knowledge).It's not an obvious favourite - the service is a little brusque (you'll almost always be given your bill before asking), the ambience is somewhat canteen-esque and the food is churned out suspiciously quickly - but god it tastes good. And it's definitely bright and cheery, K Pop tween stars and love heart shaped Polaroid arrangements line the walls - very cutesy.All in all, you don't come here for marathon dinners over a bottle of red - you come here for good, quick, honest food. Although it should be noted that while Bibimbap doesn't have the cool factor of some of its Soho neighbours, it certainly does have the queues

RA66DGe2QWtCn-JZE4iTpQ.text: The rice was burnt and the pork was just average. The dish was a bit too dry as well. Only good thing is the price. Not how it used to be. Sadly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Bibimbap with pork

zveQ0yRkf7mcMP6_6SaIrA.text: I'm pretty sure the noodles in seafood ramen come out of a package or something, and the seafood bits are minuscule, but when I'm majorly craving some hot noodles and good noodle spots are far away or take too long or it's a library night at UCL, I tend to pop over to Bibimbap for a quick dinner. The noodle soup is just a tad oversalted, but it's spicy enough that you won't notice, and for seven pounds, I'm not complaining. I've never tried the bibimbap, but friends rave about it.

JFC4sv_VoNsiDitaILVz1g.text: This is the first time that I've visited a place based on Qype user reviews.May I just say you guys know your stuff! This place was great. The food tasted great and were filling, we ordered a few different mains off the menu and all shared.Kimichi pancakes make a nice sweet starter.We were seated right away and the food came out quickly. I love the decor of the place, quite funky without being over the top.The staff were friendly and polite.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

d39JnW8oaq7DI0DpHVX6BA.text: Bibimbap is my go-to restaurant in Soho. If you're an expat earning absolutely nothing in London and you want don't want to break the bank before a night out this is the place for you! It's one of the cheapest eats right in central London. Make it there before 7pm on weekends so you don't have to wait too long, but otherwise you're guaranteed to get in pretty quickly. The food is tasty and the service is super quick. Highly recommended!

Cr2LZVuFnSPKMzPzuUGTgw.text: A friend insisted on taking our group here after an evening at the St. Barnabas.  I really wanted to like this place:Bright, inviting decorFun atmosphereAmusing customer pictures adorning the wallsNice service...but it ended up completely failing me on the main dish.I've had Korean food in different places in the UK and US- my favorite being the bulgogi, after having a spectacular version at Woo Jung just a few blocks away from this spot.  Bibimbap's version of this tasty dish was incredibly underwhelming- so far it is the most disappointing Korean dish I've had.  The sauce was the real let-down, as it makes or breaks the bulgogi dish.Bibimbap covers all the bases in terms of service, ambiance and appearance, but I'd be hard pressed to return for the food.

Z-3t7gE6KsCDyTzv36G9qA.text: I am not a Korean food expert. I have only had Bibimbap once before in my hometown that is notoriously nicknamed Johns Korea, so I trust the food I had there to be relatively authentic but most importantly, delicious. Apart from the "authenticity snobbery" the food here was equally as delicious. Several coursemates and I had stumbled in here after classes on Friday and our ritual trip to the pub. Already well... erm... socially lubricated we were ravenous and hoping to get some decent food. After stumbling around in the cold in search of this place we came across a small sliver of a restaurant; easily missed if you're not being too careful. The restaurant is small so trying to seat the 8 of us proved to be difficult. We had to wait but it wasn't very long before we were all snug in a booth in the back drinking soju (Korean Rice Liquor) and eating kimchi dumplings.I ordered the bulgolgi bibimbap which may be a bastardization of the actual traditional food but hell... it was damn good. Bulgogi is beef marinated in Korean barbecue sauce and is essentially the food stuffs of gods. I have a serious and unhealthy love affair with Korean barbecue but it's quiet expensive even back in America. Fortunately, I will take bulgolgi in a bibimbap. I got the raw egg on the Bibimbap and let it cook on the hot stones and really amid the dulling soju and real ale the food was incredibly flavorful. The meat was tender and well marinaded with a sweet, yet savory sauce. The bowl came with pickled radishes and bean sprouts that worked beautifully with the sweet and savory flavors of the meat and egg. The best part about this place was the price. £12 will get you a decent meal and in Soho... that's a bargain. It's a casual place and easily missed or forgotten about. If you're looking for a decent and different bite in the Soho area, check out Bibimbap.

T6tMecZC9IeVBkHr5R01Hw.text: I have been here a couple of times in London as this is probably the best Korean restaurant in London. Korean food is generally pricey but Bibimbap Soho has great inexpensive prices and amazing food which is the big reason why I keep coming back.Service: Is definitely okay, sometimes the waiters are a bit inattentive but most of the times they are on pointe.Food: The appetizers like the spicy rice cakes, kimchee, seafood pancake comes in very small portions but okay for sharing if you are only two. I tried the spicy chicken bibimbap and the beef bulgogi bibimbap, and they both are amazing!! They come with miso and hot sauce so you can mix the flavors how you want.Best Korean food in London!!

k0zBYdIFXpiwdgy9WlFFNA.text: Love this place! I was on a 'London Day Out' and was craving some substantial carb + veggie so bi bam bap sounded terrific!Décor: Small to comfortable sized for what it is, welcoming, with polaroids of customers eating their food on the wall. I felt comfortable even though I was eating by myself!Service: Nice, simple and quick- no complaints!Food: I got the beef bi bim bap and to my surprise it came SIZZLING. Yes, SIZZLING. The table next to me did not have their food yet and looked over several times at my dish as I mixed everything up because it smelled good, sounded good and looked good (3 out of 5 senses satisfied without even having touched it!). And when I mixed it all together with the red sauce and ate it, oh I was so happy. Nice and hot like it's supposed to be. Good balance of vegetables, beef, rice and sauce (of course, it's your personal preference of how much you want in it). I also got the Jap Chae to go. It was a tad on the oily side, but it is just like the ones I get back home in California. And for 4.95, really.. you can't beat it.Bottom Line: If you want Bi Bim Bap in London and you're in this area, I HIGHLY recommend this. The dish is less than 7 pounds and you can do take away and eat it in the nearby Soho Square if you'd like. Yes, please!

FODzv5Ev_f5kCFBp5-VA8g.text: I'm from LA so my review may be biased since there are so many awesome Korean restaurants in LA.Two things that I love about dol sot bi bim bap is the fried egg and the crispy rice that comes on the bottom of the stone bowl.  Neither came in my bulgogi bi bim bap.  I was missing Korean food, so this was good enough to satisfy my apetite.

tbq9b8EHPusQSgwMHlXUGA.text: Now I must admit that my exposure to Korean food is entirely limited to this restaurant and my actual real-life Korean friend who occasionally whips me up a multicultural storm in her Brixton kitchen.  One time, having stayed over after a particularly heavy night out, I even managed to catch her parents popping over mid-morning and, due to my enviable ability to loiter, snagged myself an invitation for lunch.  My, but those noodles were good; and her mum's home-made kimchi cleared up my hangover like a gift from the gods.But beyond that, all I know is Soho's wonderful Bi Bim Bap.  I should probably try another restaurant but I never really got around to it.  And I don't honestly see the point because I loooove Bi Bim Bap.  Looooove it.  It's worth the extra Os.  It's my go-to cheapy dinner spot in Soho, and I've dragged many a friend here to show off my international taste in good food.  It's especially ideal to lure in your pickier dining companions since the brightly-coloured decor and mini-polaroids covering the wall lend it a slightly fast-food-esque, less terrifying aura.  By the time they realise what's on offer, it's too late.Although to be fair, the food isn't live octopi or skewered snakes or whatever else Korean food has a reputation for being.  It's kind of like Thai, but you know, not really.  And it's all cooked really, um, nicely.  I don't like summing up a nation's cuisine in a few sentences because not only will I inevitably get it wrong, I'll probably insult an entire culture at the same time.I have the eponymous bi bim bap every time.  It's rice, vegetables and thinly-sliced beef in a sizzlingly hot stone bowl, which you mix around so that it cooks merely by touching the sides.  I slosh in a healthy dollop of miso sauce from the alarmingly green bottle on every table (if you're averse to heat, avoid the red one; it's not ketchup, it's mega chilli) which gives it the perfect saltiness and depth.  Much like I ought to try another restaurant, I ought to attempt another dish too, but I probably won't.  I'm all for variety but I don't really see the point of branching out here when it's Just So Good.  I have at least tried the different meats on offer (all gorgeous) and both with and without the egg (also both gorgeous) so I see no reason why the rest of it wouldn't be equally excellent.  So if you want to be the guineapig, go ahead.  But I figure if it ain't broke, don't fix it.(An aside: service is enormously hit and miss.  Friendly faces, HUGELY slow.  Last time I went, the couple next to us got their meals before we'd even had our orders taken, and we arrived first.  My companion was a lot more hacked off than me, but then I've lived in Asia so I kind of slip back into that mode and just go with the flow.  Besides, it's worth the wait).

bEp-k_xsiBj86NLwRVlD3w.text: One of the first Korean restaurants I've been to that didn't make my clothes smell like BBQ (don't believe I saw any grills in this establishment, which explains why).  Interior was very nice and cool looking.  Service was spotty.  It took a while to grab a waiter's attention and to get the bill. The spicy rice cakes were delicious and the only dish I enjoyed.  For entree, I ordered the plain chicken bool-go-gi rice, and thought I could use the kim chi side dish to give it some kick, but the dish turned out to be just average.  The chicken was very dry.  And sadly, they do not provide any side dishes at this establishment...I tried to scrape the sauce from the spicy rice cakes from my rice dish, but it didn't provide enough flavor :-(

oMxy0kn_tfIQ219MNOnxKw.text: Glad we found this place, great bibimbap and spicy pork here. I've been to Korea and loved the food here just as much as anything I tried there. I'll rate this 4 stars for now, but this could go up to 5 on future visits.

j7-JEz_7D5YwsV2RYXvs2A.text: mmmm so warm and good all the way through. I ordered the First Bi Bam Bap vegetarian option. Judging by how healthy the ingredients were, I was kind of surprised how satisfying and tasty it was. I ordered it because it came with egg and it was the most traditional. It did not disappoint The chili chicken bi bam bap is also very good. I really hope to go back.

z2jXHWJW-e9B_6ZW9Ewx4A.text: Hmmmm, rather fast food joint, with not much choice. But if you like bulgogi or bibimbap - it might be your place.

cpIaGrKhtaFz1TEWACZKIQ.text: I have eaten here twice and yet to be disappointed. I particularly like the fillet beef bibimbap at £9.45, which consists of strips of raw seasoned beef fillet that cooks once mixed in the stone bowl with the julienne vegetables. Add a raw egg, opt for brown rice, and load up on the sauce and you will have an awesomely filling and healthy meal. I can also recommend the kimchi pancake and chilli squid. Super cool to have been asked to mark my first trip with a polaroid snap, which they then stuck up on the wall amongst the many other smiling customers.

2Pc7TBXiEiDjLchVBGGnLg.text: A decent restaurant and some good fare. Portions a bit on the smaller side though if you are the hungry kind !

0Aeg2lIPQlVn21nzpC383Q.text: I've delighted in introducing friends to this delicious place since it opened. I wish I worked/lived nearby so I could go more often. Who would have thought that a steaming hot, volcanic rock bowl of rice and vegetables with a fried egg on top could be so incredibly tasty? They do also come with meat, and each time I visit I plan to try it, but them the simple veg option (dol sot) is so darn blinking good I haven't bothered to explore the menu yet. Hmmm... I want one now... Cheerful, bright, friendly... have a quick £10 supper with friends or hang out for a while in booths at the back. Just make sure you get your piccie taken for the wall :-)

ItX2H-cidK_gZy05R5CYRA.text: Decent bi bim bap, but really could have served a bit more meat. I don't want to pay 9.45 pounds for a few strips of beef.  Relatively cheap though, so this place makes a good bite if you're in the area and fancy a quick lunch.

oTfkYqk63EClAmvIID5jrQ.text: I tried the mix seafood hot stone and its the best I ever tried in town. I would recommend jap chae (S6 on the menu) for starter and seafood pancake as well. Salmon salad is the best & impressive one! Better come down earlier to avoid the long queue. No reservation available on Friday and Saturday.

xJ6Zt2WHYv0gvNBsOzc9_A.text: Recommended by several guide books, this lived up to its billing with a tasty ( if not absolutely exceptional) and affordable meal -- the bibimbap was certainly enjoyable, although I've had better bulgogi. If you don't go early there's generally a wait for dinner.

a-1j9KudhELWOlNjqDaxlw.text: The rice is great..simply the best. For me it is rather hard to prepare rice and I never do it quite good, but here...ooo, it is great

CP9Hk2zzWIO6XcZZfqJM-w.text: I am in love. Its been a long time since I had Korean food. I was skeptical at first discovering a Korean restaurant in London, but Bi Bim Bap did not fail to satisfy. I got the bulgogi bibimbap with kimchi (special request) and it was mouth wateringly delicious. I cant say the kimchi was the best, but it sufficed. You must order the kimchi pancakes--they are to die for. Absolutely incredible and comparable to Korean dishes.

JYid3SsRdih3kVO0thx27g.text: Delicious rice bowls. Stick with the white rice as you seem to get more compared to brown rice it seems! Beef bolgogi was excellent. Seafood pancake also good. Kimchi portion is tiny (be warned!). The only other negative was the place needs a bit more ventilation, especially if everyone orders the hot stone bowls. Arrive early on the weekends to avoid the queue.

7548iCbicQRh5vaUHH7Uiw.text: Friendly staff, good beer and amazing Korean food. I long for another bebimbap--fried egg and all. Meals are served in roasting hot stone bowls which keep their contents warm and continue cooking it as you eat. And it's good value at £7 for a meal or so. Nice venue, too.

G7TfJh-EMALFR7z2LvcWGg.text: what an interesting and surprisingly satisfying meal! i had the hot stone chilli chicken and boy was it good! cheap, cheerful and in the heart of soho!

IxZzxnvqsJxYnPWPrk10Xg.text: As a new Yelp member, I was about to try how accurate the mobile app was to find the closest and best restaurant options in the area I was. It was very disappointing to see on Yelp opening hours 12pm - 11pm and find myself in front of a "closed" sign of Bi Bim Bap. I believe to avoid disappointment,  more information accuracy would be appreciated.  I still want to go but readers, please check opening hours with the restaurants before.

KcIGQwAeGZyirckob0N7AQ.text: Okay, so if you have an item of food in your name, I expect you to be good at it, and this place does deliver. Their stone bowls are great! Stir it up as soon as possible and keep it moving but allow for some of it to get crusty on the bottom.It's not a huge place but they have both upstairs and downstairs and should be able to accommodate a party of about 8 or so. I'm a Bulgogi fan so that's what I normally go for, but their spicy pork is also good, not tried any of the others so I'll leave that for other people to review.Sadly, I think their sides let them down a little, the seafood pancake seemed expensive for what we got, really light on the seafood compared to other places, and the glass noodles Jap Chae were also more expensive and not as good as elsewhere. Make no mistake, they are good, but I'll get them elsewhere unless somebody else is ordering them.When (that's a when, not an if) I go again, I'll stick to the bibimbaps, but for a relatively quick eat in Soho, I can't really complain. Oh, and Hite beer, always a plus.

-0ozcnVSCU-ZdMNBx4Km2Q.text: I have been to this restaurant about twenty times - great for a quick meal. The bibimbap are the star of the show (don't forget the raw egg and I ask for brown rice). I also like a side of kimchi. Some of the starters are winners too .. For example the Jap chae.

q7kO5fttP91POd4jlK4ojQ.text: One of the worst dinning experience: terrible service. First I was asked to wait until my friend arrived to get seated, because that was the "rule" but then I saw many people were seating there alone waiting... after I waited half an hour I thought maybe my friend was downstairs already and I maybe could just check, then the waiter said No, "because no one is there"... after another 10 min, my friend come up from downstairs ! Because there were no signal there... can't believe this, this horrible restaurant can survive in London... The food is so so .. more like Korean fast food.. anyway won't be there again ...

tY7LQzUBljFvmjdvC-BKUw.text: We were a group of 12 hungry shoppers on Friday night, 10 of whom had never eatenKorean food before! Good thing we got there at 6pm on the dot, since there was already a line. We were able to get 2 booths in the back. For starters we shared a few sides: the dumplings, sweet potato noodles, and kimchi pancakes. Nothing too special, but good. The noodles are just like regular glass noodles. But the main event was AMAZING! We all got the bulgogi bibimbap and doused it in the miso sauce and chili sauce. Searing hot bowls, great flavor on the meat, crispy pickled veggies, and a perfect fried egg. Unbeatable prices. When we left the line was around the block. Next time I'm in London I would honestly go back. Huge hit.

iAp3mEWd1udsiNic0eQrIw.text: As I walked around London today, I knew I wanted something different to eat and this place hit the spot.  I am a Korean American with access to a variety of Asian food in Southern California so I was a bit skeptical at first; however, after my first bite, I knew I made the right decision. I thoroughly enoyed every bite of the beef bibimbap. I ordered it with a raw egg and everything cooked within seconds in their hot pot.  If you're in the mood for something different, put this place at the top of your list. I gave it 4 stars because nothing is better than my grandma's home cooking :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Fillet Beef Bibimbap

ZmEWGgHnjTAi9QuTsswO0w.text: Excellent food if you crave this sort of thing.  I had the raw beef Bibimbap with raw egg.  Also I added a couple of shots of soju that rounded out the meal.  Excellent place for a casual meal with some Korean flare!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Mixed up with some additional spicy sauce
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Bibimbap with raw egg
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Korean fried chicken  - excellent!

q9INJwxauQCRXaTuHnXJEA.text: I came here after having a good experience at the Bibimbap in Fitzrovia/Bloomsbury. In terms of atmosphere and feel, it's the same. Though I'm not a huge fan of the music, it works for the space and the service.I ordered the rice cake starter and a bibimbap with tofu strips for lunch. For some reason, this time everything just tasted too sweet. Some bits of rice cake weren't cooked well enough, and the sauce, rather than leaving you with a nice rounded taste in your mouth, was just sticky and sweet. The bibimbap itself had generous toppings, but it basically was all toppings and the flavour of the tofu was overpowering. Maybe I'll order the dish without the tofu strips next time, but it'd be nice to have a little bit more rice to add some more substance to the dish!Good for a quick craving, but I'm still looking for a good bibimbap unfortunately...

lguwdGOC_I-FWx14yInoQw.text: My visit today for lunch was a little mixed!The decor was appropriately bright and well decorated with tiny poloroids of who I assume are regulars?The bibimbap was presented with lots of fresh veggies and well spiced pork, though the fried egg was not as runny as I would have wished. The stone bowl was burning hot as it should be, keeping the dish toasty until the last bite.My issues included the general stickiness of all the restaurant surfaces- table, floor and bathroom handles! Also staff was a bit aloof and seemed all too eager to clear our plates and hustle us out the door.I've had better bibimbap to be honest but for £7 this was a good option for lunch today!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

d8ZKI3sSt4-VAMcE6Mw9AQ.text: Great food and great service. Quite a popular place but I didn't have to wait too long to be seated or to get my food. Ordered the bulgogi bibimbap, which was delicious, although I wish the meat had a little bit more flavor. Would definitely visit again if I'm ever in the area because the dishes that the people around me ordered looked delicious.

aTOWZfDOe6vZ4N5CqDZyKQ.text: I found bibimhap on yelp and got it for Carry out which was presented very nicely and came with many topping. Perhaps the dining in experience is different but I would have liked my beef bulgogi to include the sauce in which it was cooked it. Meat was marinade well but was not given the sauce of bulgogi so the rice was very plain and dry.

DG8nwoZsqHubS40Leowd4A.text: The bap itself is nourishing and wholesome though not very sophisticated, but the location is a bit gaudy, and the staff was a bit snotty.

IykAllXSYAtttyh9TXgv9w.text: My friends and I came here looking for something with plenty of veggies, so a bibimbap was perfect. We ordered a spicy pork one and a beef one. The veggies were quite tasty, but the meat itself were rough and overcooked.

ND84kNVOfU1gJsRe9k7dOw.text: Delicious! I have been wanting to try this place for a long time now and tonight I finally got around to goi g there and it was worth the wait. The menu was simple and easy to understand. There was more vegetarian choice than I expected, especially considering Koreans don't have a word for vegetarians in their language. I ordered the Kimchi bibimbap with a fried egg and my friend ordered the original with brown rice. Both were good. I'll try the brown rice next time.

bh-kwJxlcCoOWlBD83y8fg.text: This is one of my favourite little spots in Soho. I love how popular affordable food is now, and this place is a great example. There may be a small queue to get a table, and the interior may be ever so slightly basic, but it is all part of the great Bibimbap experience.This is where I discovered the Korean Bibimbap dish, a super hot stone bowl filled with rice, veg and a choice of toppings, all mixed up and sizzling in front of you. The sauces on the table (chilli and miso) are a great addition, as is the raw egg which joins everything together as it cooks. This is one of the most delicious dishes you can get for under £7 in London. Get some kimchi on the side and a bottle of Korean beer, you won't be disappointed. Then keep going back! Yum!

BdUeTlWs-2pa8XwwEjC78Q.text: The food tasted great and very well presented. The food I had was chicken teriyaki served with rice and mix sides and kimchi pancake. Quick service! Great for a lunch break! I recommend to stop by and give it a try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi pancake
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Chicken teriyaki

dYWw_gU1ONYcy-A2e1FUsw.text: Yummy, cheap, dolsot bibimbap...what's not to like?This is the perfect place for a speedy bite to eat to soak up cocktails from the amazing bars in this area. Dolsot bibimbap (less than £7!) is served in a heated stone bowl, so the rice /meat/veg keeps cooking while you eat it...this means you need to eat quite quickly...or the rice will get a bit dry.I looove Korean flavours...and bibimbap did not disappoint:****     Dolsot bibimbap - Maybe not the best in London, but really good.*****   Spicy Pork - My boyfriend ate this so fast that I only tried a teeny bit, but it was lovely.****     Jap Chae - also yummy!***       Kimchi - nom nom nom**        Gyoza - not bad...I've had better thoughThere are hundreds of photos of people who have come here to munch their bibimbap...and I was happy to see one of my colleagues on the wall with her hubby - so I'm not the only one that loves it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Gyoza (^^)
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Korean version of umeshu

Rui9IVLplRe_XoDYGwQZjg.text: This is a great place if you're in the mood for Korean and on a tighter budget. We ordered the seafood soon tofu stew with white rice and hot stone bowl tofu bibimbap with fried egg for £19. Both tasted great, right up there with similar dishes at popular restaurants we've been to in LA.The service was meh, typical for a crowded and understaffed little establishment like this one. Also, would have liked to have the standard Korean side dishes accompany the mains, but they cost extra.

nPpBzlYL8KloQWacFxHikA.text: If I'm ever looking for a comforting, tasty, and quick meal after work or before a gig/show, I like to head to bibimbap. After 18:30 there is generally a short queue outside, but this moves fairly quickly.  Unfortunately, they do not take bookings.On this occasion I had the mixed mushroom Bibimbap. The dish comes served in a fiery hot stone bowl, three types of mushrooms and an assortment of crunchy vegetables on top of rice.  I love the pre-eating part of a bibimbap.  The sizzle of the veg as you stir it around the bowl, allowing it to soften a little. I like to leave a layer of rice on the bottom to cook longer, as it forms a chewy crunchy crust.Sriracha and miso sauce come served in red and yellow ketchup and mustard squeeze bottles.  So you can load up on as much or as little sauce as you fancy.Service is quick, food is delicious!

BphdgtY4flLXNEGoTmXUBQ.text: Great little restaurant for a quick meal.I went with a friend after work. We both ordered a bibimbap. Generous amount of veg and beef for the price! The restaurant is small but busy, the queue was fairly long when we walked out.

j-WnU4q1m_j7K3YD93gxIQ.text: The food is mediocre. I ordered Bulgogi and the meat was dry and had little flavor. I was really excited to try the restaurant out since the reviews were great and I love Korean food. I would not come back. The service was also pretty bad.

gqNEUIriblhjzUVN68egHQ.text: Having been thwarted in our attempt to go to Hoppers (A three hour wait? On a weekday? Ain't nobody got time for that), we decided to try out Bibimbap Soho, and it was a good choice!Neither of us had ever had bibimbap but we both understood the concept. We were pleased the see the restaurant was full (an empty restaurant is generally a bad sign!) and we only had to wait a few minutes for a table.I quickly decided on the Beef Bulgogi Bibimbap, and the person with me had the spicy pork. Both were delicious, but I preferred mine. The beef was a touch dry but as I am completely in love with the squirty bottle of miso sauce, there was no trouble. The beef was lovely and lean and sliced thinly. I didn't get an egg but I will next time - a raw egg would really have brought the whole thing together.The bowl kept everything roasting throughout the meal, and even when I'd finished (and I'm not a fast eater) the bowl was too hot to hold. We didn't get any sides but still neither of us were able to finish our meals. So to leave a restaurant full, but not overstuffed and heavy but instead slightly virtuous (I left rice, not veg!) for under £10 a head in Soho is pretty damn good.I'm sure I'll be here all winter!

0KO9AoKiGuGawZXVQMzpuw.text: Annoyingly, they only serve bibimbap on the weekends. We were told nothing else was on offer. Food was tasty but our service was really lacking. She didn't mention the bibimbap only on the weekend until we had already spent time deciding on what to order. We ordered wine which the waitress failed to bring over. She just seemed really unengaged with everything. Overall, not a great experience.

FJ82cLDVMO6LOqsU0cbanw.text: I love bibimbap SO MUCH and ever since I became gluten intolerant I've had to go without (soy sauce makes its wicked way into everything, it seems). This is the first Korean place I've ever found that has clearly labeled gluten free options. I got the raw beef hot bowl and it was AMAZING. I would have licked the bowl if it wouldn't have burned all the skin off my tongue. Absolutely as good as anything I've had in Los Angeles. Staff was friendly, service was fast, but the space was pretty crowded so some strategic hovering might be in order.

fQdUU7r8jFJwo_-AFni-ag.text: Happened to be in the neighbourhood and was pleasantly surprised to find a Korean restaurant right by Berkeley Square. As one would guess, this establishment specialised in Bibimbaps; which are rice bowls served in hot stone bowels. In short, you select the bibimbap filling (veggies, beef, spicy pork, seafood, or spicy chicken), the type of rice (white or brown), if you'd like a raw or fried egg (I'd recommend the traditional raw egg). We shared a spicy pork bibimbap, seafood pancake (haemul pajeun), chapjae with bulgogi and a pair of Cass beers. The food was delicious and tasty and we'll be back to try the steak bibimbap next time .

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Chapjae with bulgogi.
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Make sure to mix in the raw egg; and enjoy the crispy rice bits as the bowl continues to cook the contents !
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. The tasty seafood pancake; one of my faves!

tD2K_Yj2fbcb0tDDNpf-pg.text: Really nice place with amazing tasty food. The place is simple but the food is traditional and really tasty. The quality was really good and cheap. We really enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Spicy squid
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

w01J4IC1mKMuL6Pg1431Bw.text: My friend had been recommended this place  however I wasn't so sure on the idea!However I normally choose the restaurants so I went with it!I was really impressed. We didn't book and were seated straight away! Plenty of space upstairs and downstairs.We ordered the local beer which was pretty nice and both went for a bibimbap which are rice dishes with veg and meat cooked in the bowl it's served it (beware v hot)They delish! Really filling, plenty of flavour and served quickly for a good price!Would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

6UJnXF2NgsIBRfs8gw9I4Q.text: Small space, can get a bit crowded, but worth either sitting at the bar of there is a line. I got the chili chicken bi bim bap and highly recommended it. Especially with the miso soup (or doen jang guk.)  My hubby got the beef (bulgogi) bi bim bap and he tried mine and said he would have gotten mine if he could have.

6mFtL1xsQwUBVNJ-232jJg.text: HOW did I not try this place sooner?! I feel a strange need to hi-five someone about my recent visit, because I can't actually think of another place in central London that bags the holy trinity of casual eats better than these guys - affordable, healthy AND goddamn delicious!It has a buzzing canteen-style vibe and you can't book ahead, but there's a hidden downstairs area that means it's bigger than you think so we didn't have to wait long for a table for two.Obvs you have to go for the eponymous traditional bibimbap (if only to enjoy saying the word out loud). I chose the chilli chicken which was tasty and filling, and all the fresh veggies made me feel good. A dash of the chilli sauce on the table went with it nicely - note this isn't ketchup despite the look of the bottle. Also remember not to grab the sizzling hotter-than-the-sun stone bowl with your bare hand in your excitement to get to the bottom (doh)... I was extra glad about my cold bottle of Hite at that point!Service is brusque as you might expect but this place had everything I needed to pick-me-up on a cold, rainy London eve. My date was winning before he'd even opened his mouth... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. bibimbap - nice to say, even nicer to eat!

sxYhlurddvFN3SB_8qm1zg.text: Went here tonight, first of all amazing atmosphere, the really friendly staff show you to a table. The menu has a large choice of reasonably priced korean dishes, I chose a Dol Sot  and my friend had a   (Kim Chi Bibimbap), these were served after a very short wait, which was good since we were hungry, they were served in these Wonderful hot traditional dishes, and tasted well... like if paradise had a taste well that's what it would taste like. So if you want a real rauthentic korean meal, this reasonably priced place is totally the place to go. I strongly recommend it !

dLe0U9dx4EUQuhy_17sRQg.text: Good, quick, clean, cheap, friendly service. I had the filet with a raw egg and it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Filet with a raw egg. Don't worry, it cooks!

gaum8W72ZNH7PCSd6q_gDw.text: Note if there was an option to give 3.5 stars that would be a more accurate reflection of my review. Bimbimbap "does what it says on the tin" - it offers bimbimbap that is satisfying, tasty and hot. The pickles are fresh and nicely sour and the starters such as the tofu, kimchi pancake and mixed vegetables are also noticeably fresh and well seasoned. However the shortfalls are the meat is average with not much flavour, the menu is quite limited and the bimbimbap is so hot it leaves you vigorously stirring and blowing on the food to prevent the rice or your mouth getting burnt. The setting, music and service is pleasant so this restaurant is good as an occasional healthy dine out but perhaps not for special occasions and is not for everybody.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Mixed vegetables starter, kimchi pancake and chicken bimbimbap

-8gdeZk4h1cU_8eZOKjCZg.text: Small portions for the bibimbap but surprisingly good and if you order an appetizer you'll fill up. I just got the classic, and smothered it with my favourite chili sauce. Yum! Careful though, the stone bowl is HOT and you may burn your greedy mouth if you eat too fast. Not much else to say! To explain bibimbap - it's really just various traditional Korean mixed veggie dishes on rice with a nice egg on top. Stir in chili sauce to taste...and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

gNVPYLrHJORNM1vTCuAKUA.text: Reading the reviews I thought this place is really good and delicious, well I was mislead. Bibimbap is among my top 10 dishes worldwide. Having the original ones in Korea is an experience but you would think this is a simple dish and no one should have a problem making it especially when one knows the techniques and flavors. OK some pluses, the location is easy to find, close to the underground, the service is good, prices are also not high so its an affordable dish plus the menu is promising.I had Beef Bool-Go-Gi wth a side of kimchi. The kimchi was OK whereas the beef was super dry, not sweet at all and quiet tough big chunks. Well I know my bulgogi well, and if proper cuts of beef were used and marinated properly this would be a good dish but this was a letdown! Hence my rating, I definitely had better bulgogi even in London and not even compering to the ones in Korea.Given the good reviews and some options I would like to try I will try to visit this place once more and maybe update my rating but for now IF U EVER HAD TE REAL DEAL or like your beef juicy and tender then avoid Beef Bool-Go-Gi Bibimbap!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

c_JRSHRP7sYv5EFkWQTiiA.text: I kinda lost it when I discovered I could get Bibimbap in Soho.Not only is it fun to say, it's pretty much the epitome of happiness in a hot stone bowl. With thinly sliced beef bulgo-gi, shredded crisp veg and fluffy steamed rice (choose brown or white), it's amazing. It's hard to find such goodness for under £10 especially in Soho.Service is fast and friendly, even when I went on a Friday evening and the place was packed and buzzing with people. They also serve up ramen for those looking to get their noodle fix. Okay great, I'm hungry now.

ZLNYvqSq7Gptnmf7BpZDmQ.text: Bulgogi beef is marinated beef. I got their bulgogi beef bibimbap and it was definitely not marinated. No flavor at all and instead of being brown  and looking flavorful it looks dull and gray as cooked liver. The mushrooms, carrots, onions, and even the rice had more flavor than their beef.£8.50 paid with card .50p and a pound discretionary fee, so £10 for the worst tasting Korean food I've ever had.

jvUMVC8x8mDgwWLdF0HkYQ.text: The bibimbap is good. The price is decent 9$ for a bowl. Pour your own sauce. Not too much vegetable.

QkLQ0mXhFXn8CmCqC6QpTg.text: Really great fast and inexpensive place to grab lunch or dinner but maybe don't come here on a really hot day. Since it's a small restaurant with a lot of tables squeezed into a tiny space and everyone is eating from extremely hot stone bowls, it gets a little bit warm. In the winter this could be an incentive to come and have a hearty meal but on a really hot day, I don't think I'd brave the heat.The food is great, service friendly and fast. The waiter was very attentive and came to refill our teapot before we'd even realised we had emptied it. The sauce (miso and goju) is self serve and although I was generous, I found that the goju sauce didn't have the kick I was expecting. Something to keep in mind if you are into spicy food.There is the choice of white or brown rice, egg or no egg and raw or fried. The menu here is small but I have admit that I didn't even go over most of it as I had decided on a vegetarian bi bim bap before I even sat down.Great place for an inexpensive dinner in an area of town not particularly renowned for its wallet friendly reputation.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom bi bim bap.
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Beef bulgogi.
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom bi bim bap, beef bulgogi and kimchi pancake.

zQV1KzlTKum4UH4HRNkdLw.text: London is chilly but I don't care when I'm inside with a hot bowl of dolsot bibimbap keeping me company.  As the name suggests, they do great bibimbap, and that is where their strength lies as I have tried the bulgogi but found it just okay. I really enjoyed my beef bibimbap with egg on top. The flavour isn't going to be a revelation , but it will be tasty, comforting, and leave you feeling warm and happy.An extra plus for me was ordering my first glass of aloe vera juice here and I found it surprisingly yummy and refreshing.  The decor is charming with a heart made out of polaroids of customers and the price is great too. I'm looking forward to coming back already!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Aloe vera juice. Yummy!
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

gGsqoZ4C4k8AZd6zE-efXw.text: Colorful and tasty food, nice price, quick moving queue, bustle vibeReally loved both the mushroom and the tofu bibimbap -- vegetarian friendly :)  The dishes are a colorful, flavorful mix, and love the cracked egg on top (but remember to mix it up).  A word of caution to save burning your tongue -- because the stone bowls are extremely hot, it works opposite of how you normally eat hot food from bowls -- start from the center and work your way to the edges.  Very reasonable prices to boot.Went on a Friday evening and though the queue was almost out the door, it moved quickly, we were seated within 15 minutes.  That quick pace stayed with us though in the restaurant -- the waiters don't waste time and the food comes out promptly.  Not a place for a relaxed, leisurely experience, but they do prompt and efficient very well.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. bibimbap with tofu and egg as served
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. bibimbap with tofu and egg, all stirred up

F85IpwCIZVz4x_2Pe0qJ8g.text: Obsessed. I try to get something different every time I come here. But either way it's always full of fresh veggies and comes in their wonderful hot stone bowls! (I strongly suggest a glass of the Aloe Vera water too from here!) It's small but they are fest and turn the tables around quick! I usually get there about 5.30/6 and have never had to wait for a table.... But I've been eating and there's been a queue out the door before. I'm also in love with theI miso sauce they give you! Think of it as the ketchup of Korean food! Amazing!

LwXy4vMHuCkrdOZR0EVRig.text: Tasty treat. Just wish they weren't so skimpy on the beef. Ordered a bowl, flavor and freshness were evident, but there was very little beef on top. Service was great as well. If ever I am back in London, I would stop by again and perhaps order a plate with the hope of more beef.

3ZluX0VxL7AhN2tPEIjmCw.text: One of my most memorable nights in London was dining at Bibimbap and exploring Soho. This place serves up some legit Korean bowls. I've recent discovered my obsession with beef bulgogi bowls and so when I coworker recommended this place for dinner I almost jumped with joy. And this place did not disappoint. I was served a massively meaty bowl complete with all the veggies (sans mushrooms) and a beautiful fried egg on top.  I devoured the whole thing as I knew I would. My only complaint was the service. They struggled to get our orders correct and we had to scoop food off one bowl and put it on another to make it work. If a group of 6 threw them off I can't image how frazzled they might get with larger groups. But once we began digging in we hardly cared about the mix up. They also have a light Korean beer that pairs nicely with the richness of the bowls. I highly recommend this place if you are in the Soho area!

F1CJPyuxk0Uyp57xRrpVAA.text: So glad my friend and I came here. I came back home and all I want to eat is Korean food, specifically japchae. Although the serving sizes in London are generally smaller than I am accustomed I am very glad they had an option of ordering a side of these noddles. If you are a noodle lover I would recommend these in a heartbeat. As far as the fried chicken goes I was expecting for the sauce to come already on the chicken, but it didn't it came as a side that you could dip the chicken in so this was a bit of a disappointment. The food did take a little bit to come out, but there was a line of people since it was a weekend night so this makes sense.

uss72P5GXjDeI2rpgABhPw.text: I've had bibimbap at many places but all outside Korea i.e. Dublin, London and Osaka, and I really liked the ones here. The portions were perfect as I find many places serve way too much and I always end up wasting it, but here was just right. The menu had some very interesting choices with a lot of variety from the usual veggie, chicken and seafood ones to ginkoa nutrition bowls and even raw beef! I loved the choice of brown rice and raw egg available, and there was plenty of choice for sides. The location is about a few mins walk from Tottenham station right in Soho. The downside is that it's small and very popular so parties of 2 or more may have to queue a bit. But there's plenty of bar seats for single customers, so I didn't feel guilty of taking up a table. The service was fairly efficient and the prices were reasonable around £8-11. Overall, excellent bibimbap with great variety and good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom bibimbap with brown rice and raw egg
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

0TfxLieG5EuWboPQSS512Q.text: Nan, definitely over rated. Went there for lunch and tried seafood bibimbap and gingsen tea. Service was pretty good but food is just so-so

9WejdJeP9h4LzZ0T7fPc6w.text: Kind of torn because the food was good and service was fast. But my stone bowl wasn't hot! There was no sizzle :(I assume this was a one off error because the next table got hot bowl and everything seemed fine.Altogether just ok. Might give it another chance if I'm back in the neighborhood.

ALP_aJdRyLAlPDXwcGQ9Jg.text: We ate here for dinner and the food was pretty average in my opinion. The service was fairly quick despite there being a queue. We got seated at the bar which was fine for the 2 of us. The food was pretty average. Bibimbap didn't have crispy rice (maybe the bowl wasn't hot enough?) And the flavors we're just so-so. I got the kimchi soup and the soup flavor was incredibly sweet. There were maybe 3 pieces of tofu which made it feel lacking. I've had this dish before at other restaurants and this one stood out as being not as good.

rgr0E5EnHCzo0zu7hfUHhA.text: Average bibimbap (but I've lived in LA and NYC, had it in Seoul too), but reasonably priced and in a great location in London.They must have updated since Ada C's review, because bibimbap was available on a weekday for me. Bibimbap provides a great fast casual Asian food experience for the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

SAAAJgBhtfMxFdMMEgcO9A.text: Went there because read it was cheaper... Will never go to a place for that reason ever again. Ordered '' Spicy bacon '' They serve it in a heated bowl, and that's precisely why i do Not recommend going there. From the tase and quality of food this is what I think they do,  they just heat up the bowl and add veggies and meat that are couple of days old at least, which seat somewhere (frozen perhaps or worse) I have to say I feel shitty afterwards.. Tgats how they manage to serve it so fast, and that their whole business model.

ZLXbsHBSqBjZJRq1kApC5g.text: Ingredients are very fresh and tasty. Great location and prices are reasonable. Will definitely come back.

raR7NtgFrTQabtt5E1oPtw.text: Delicious food, nice service, and so many vegetables! I love being able to find places that will satisfy both my husband's need for meat and my need for vegetables.

abgSqSQVy7xJ-5r8-iUK1A.text: The restaurant was very hard to find but when we arrive we were so hungry and people was very cool and polite. The dinner service was quick. Food was a very tasty. We love it and it's not so expansive.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom

S4pmNEYj56z9wYiyH3cyPA.text: Being a Korean, this place is a disgrace to my food and my people.It really pisses me off that foreigners who don't have good idea of what Korean food is really like, will think this is authentic Korean food!I had spicy pork bibimbab and soon tofu soup.Pork was not properly seasoned and the soup had weird flavor. Chili paste(gochujang) on the table didn't taste like Korean chili.Nothing was right about the food.I would have returned the food if they served this shitty stuff in Korea.Don't give me the crap saying this is localized.Many people are already exposed to thai spicy, mexican spicy, and they can handle Korean spicy.I wanted to give silent signal to the people coming in. "Get out! Save yourselves!!!)

tLVsIQQeMZO8OJqoj0xVBw.text: Good Korean food for a good price in London! I have the kimchi bibimbap with a raw egg on the top and it was delicious ! And I really appreciated to have my bibimbap served in the traditional hot stone bowl! I drank a Solomon's seal tea, was good and relaxing.I recommended this place for cheap and good bibimbap !

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi bibimbap and Solomon's seal tea

NyW2Axzwg1KrfDSKjX6xRw.text: Great food, great prices, friendly staff, and great place for an intimate date. I recommend getting the dish share's the restaurant's name.

yQ2cyZtnUmWkuptIQgAYjA.text: Good food and decent price. Adding egg costed one pound and brown rice = extra charges. Other than that, really great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Teriyaki chicken

CzLoGlbxKngXjVdEqLQF9A.text: Went there before theatre. On saturday at 5pm there was plenty of space but it can vary a lot, I think I was lucky. Food was good, not super spicy but then I tolerate a lot of heat so take that with a grain of salt. Very much like the idea of Bibimbap, somewhat healthy option. Always take the egg! Once I didn't and it was a bitter disappointment. Also do try the sauces that come. They might look like ketchup and mustard but they're not! The place itself is cramped a little but still somewhat comfortable. I was seated at a 2 person table at the end of ground floor and was surprised at how far I was from my partner. Not a big deal. Liked the chairs and really liked how the place looked, the graphic design. My companion cared less for it. Look at photos posted, very honest. And be careful of the bowl! Very hot!

CfKa_3gkwSuryxnQc8xRtQ.text: Bibimbap is a traditional Korean main dish cooked in a round stone pot, with a mix of rice, meat (or not) and veggies, which comes to your table super-hot and which you have to mix all together - just don't touch the pot. I had their delicious and fresh bibimbap pot with teriyaki chicken for a very reasonable £9, which filled me up very satisfyingly. I added a little red hot sauce. Service was fast and very courteous. Recommended.

Ta_mGbDBvrHnHKQi_ZWx6g.text: Amongst friends, the act of going to Bibimbap (now a regular occurrence) has entered our lexicographical pantheon as 'bappin' it'.To BAP - intransitive verb - to attend a branch of Bibimbap.The main thing you're gonna want to order is the Bibimbap.What's a Bibimbap?Meat and/or veg served in a very hot stone bowl.Why is a Bibimbap good?A Bibimbap is good because it is cooked right there in front of you.  So you're guaranteed a hot, hot meal.  Be careful.  Stir and eat from the middle out.That just sounds like a bunch of ingredients thrown together with some rice in a hot bowl.  Why is that so good?Correct, you have accurately summarised what a Bibimbap is.  However, it works really well and they use high quality ingredients (ie nice mushrooms, and I never think mushrooms are nice).  You get some Korean specialty stuff in there like dol sot and kimchi.  Yum yum.  A fried egg works well if you throw it into the mix.Just throw it into the mix and see what happens.THROW IT!  INTO THE MIX!Also, great table sauces.  Try a little of the miso sauce.  Then a little of the sriracha sauce.  Then just tip the contents of both bottles directly into your mouth.Bibimbap needs to up its desert game but otherwise, new staple hangout for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Bibimbap - London, United Kingdom. Dol sot Bibimbap with root tea.

0ce0mZLxGWt1qTbvClPIfA.text: Disappointed the Korean fried chicken was not available but not the reason for the stars given. Asked if banchan is given also, and she was like...uh, what's that? Oh boy...ordered the bibimbap bowls and it's a good size. The taste was just ok. Also ordered the seafood pancake and it looked undercooked. It wasn't even crispy.

_8N6HJX1JAblw33vToms9Q.text: Nom nom nom.  So yummy! I had never tried BBB before coming to this restaurant and I love when you discover a new tasty food.  If you've never heard of Bi Bim Bap or Korean food then give it a whirl, you wont be disappointed.Fair pricing, fast service, generous portions ensure I return on a bi-weekly basis.  Love the spicy rice cake appetizer (not what you'd expect) and a fan of both the beef bool-go-gi and the chilli chicken.  Just ask for brown rice instead of white to make it a bit healthier than it already is and try both sauces they set on your table but be gentle with them, it's pretty yummy as is too.Enjoy!

EvMWKfAKL9WZpb-lBvuDVg.text: A great option if you're looking for a quick cheap eat central! crummbs.co.uk/bibimpap

0cbyQSqHvk57yjiMZPv4mg.text: I know that service is not a top priority in most places, but sometimes I can't help but yell, "COME ON!"It was busy for a Wednesday night, but our waitress was not trying to make her life easier in any way. We seated ourselves at a dirty table. And it took 10 whole minutes for it to be cleaned. It took 30 whole minutes to get our beer. And our food came out 10 minutes after that! And to top it off they mixed up our order. And you know that situation when EVERYONE else is getting served before you even when they arrived later? Yeah, it was like that the whole evening.*Sigh* But despite all these things, I'm planning to come back! After spending a month in Korea, this is the best I've come to great bibimbap. Hopefully, they hire more people before I go back!

CANfh3bIaah9WUHIL9BJsQ.text: Priced at around £7-9 their Dolsot (meaning 'hot stone bowl' in Korean) Bibimbap is undoubtedly great value for the money.
